title: Requires health insurance policies to cover comprehensive ultrasound screening and magnetic resonance imaging for breast cancer in certain cases
summary: Requires individual and group health insurance policies, and health maintenance organizations to provide coverage for comprehensive ultrasound screening and/or magnetic resonance imaging for breast cancer in certain cases; requires mammography reports to include information about breast density.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         1431

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                    January 7, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M.  of  A. PHEFFER, MILLMAN, THIELE, CYMBROWITZ, COLTON,
         M. MILLER, LANCMAN, WEISENBERG, PAULIN, TITONE, ORTIZ, HOOPER,  MAYER-
         SOHN,  MAGNARELLI,  SCARBOROUGH  --  Multi-Sponsored  by  --  M. of A.
         BOYLAND,  DenDEKKER,  GLICK,   GUNTHER,   JAFFEE,   MARKEY,   McENENY,
         O'DONNELL,  P. RIVERA,  RUSSELL,  SWEENEY,  WEPRIN  --  read  once and
         referred to the Committee on Insurance

       AN ACT to amend the insurance  law,  in  relation  to  requiring  health
         insurance  policies  to  cover  comprehensive ultrasound screening and
         magnetic resonance imaging for breast  cancer  in  certain  cases  and
         requiring  the  provision  of  certain  information relating to breast
         density to patients

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Paragraph  11  of  subsection  (i) of section 3216 of the
    2  insurance law is amended by adding a new subparagraph  (D)  to  read  as
    3  follows:
    4    (D)  (I)  SUCH POLICY SHALL PROVIDE ADDITIONAL COVERAGE FOR COMPREHEN-
    5  SIVE ULTRASOUND SCREENING AND/OR MAGNETIC RESONANCE IMAGING (MRI) OF  AN
    6  ENTIRE BREAST OR THE ENTIRETY OF BOTH BREASTS IF:
    7    (I)  A  MAMMOGRAM  DEMONSTRATES  HETEROGENEOUS  OR DENSE BREAST TISSUE
    8  BASED ON THE BREAST IMAGING REPORTING AND DATA SYSTEM ESTABLISHED BY THE
    9  AMERICAN COLLEGE OF RADIOLOGY; OR
   10    (II) A WOMAN IS BELIEVED TO BE AT INCREASED RISK FOR BREAST CANCER DUE
   11  TO FAMILY HISTORY OR PRIOR PERSONAL HISTORY OF BREAST  CANCER,  POSITIVE
   12  GENETIC  TESTING  OR  OTHER  INDICATIONS  AS  DETERMINED BY SUCH WOMAN'S
   13  PHYSICIAN OR NURSE PRACTITIONER.
   14    (II) SUCH ADDITIONAL COVERAGE MAY BE SUBJECT TO ANNUAL DEDUCTIBLES AND
   15  COINSURANCE AS MAY BE DEEMED APPROPRIATE BY THE  SUPERINTENDENT  AND  AS
   16  ARE  CONSISTENT WITH THOSE ESTABLISHED FOR OTHER BENEFITS WITHIN A GIVEN
   17  POLICY.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD00386-01-1

       A. 1431                             2

    1    (III) EACH MAMMOGRAPHY REPORT PROVIDED  TO  A  PATIENT  SHALL  INCLUDE
    2  INFORMATION  ABOUT BREAST DENSITY, BASED ON THE BREAST IMAGING REPORTING
    3  AND DATA SYSTEM ESTABLISHED BY THE AMERICAN COLLEGE OF RADIOLOGY.  WHERE
    4  APPLICABLE,  SUCH  REPORT  SHALL  INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING NOTICE: "IF YOUR
    5  MAMMOGRAM  DEMONSTRATES  THAT  YOU HAVE DENSE BREAST TISSUE, WHICH COULD
    6  HIDE SMALL ABNORMALITIES, YOU MIGHT BENEFIT FROM SUPPLEMENTARY SCREENING
    7  TESTS, WHICH CAN INCLUDE A BREAST ULTRASOUND SCREENING OR A  BREAST  MRI
    8  EXAMINATION,  OR  BOTH,  DEPENDING  ON  YOUR  INDIVIDUAL RISK FACTORS. A
    9  REPORT OF YOUR MAMMOGRAPHY RESULTS,  WHICH  CONTAINS  INFORMATION  ABOUT
   10  YOUR  BREAST  DENSITY,  HAS BEEN SENT TO YOUR PHYSICIAN'S OFFICE AND YOU
   11  SHOULD CONTACT YOUR PHYSICIAN IF YOU  HAVE  ANY  QUESTIONS  OR  CONCERNS
   12  ABOUT THIS REPORT."
   13    S  2.  Paragraph 11 of subsection (l) of section 3221 of the insurance
   14  law is amended by adding a new subparagraph (D) to read as follows:
   15    (D) (I) SUCH POLICY SHALL PROVIDE ADDITIONAL COVERAGE  FOR  COMPREHEN-
   16  SIVE  ULTRASOUND SCREENING AND/OR MAGNETIC RESONANCE IMAGING (MRI) OF AN
   17  ENTIRE BREAST OR THE ENTIRETY OF BOTH BREASTS IF:
   18    (I) A MAMMOGRAM DEMONSTRATES  HETEROGENEOUS  OR  DENSE  BREAST  TISSUE
   19  BASED ON THE BREAST IMAGING REPORTING AND DATA SYSTEM ESTABLISHED BY THE
   20  AMERICAN COLLEGE OF RADIOLOGY; OR
   21    (II)  A WOMAN IS BELIEVED TO BE AT AN INCREASED RISK FOR BREAST CANCER
   22  DUE TO FAMILY HISTORY OR PRIOR PERSONAL HISTORY OF BREAST CANCER,  POSI-
   23  TIVE  GENETIC TESTING OR OTHER INDICATIONS AS DETERMINED BY SUCH WOMAN'S
   24  PHYSICIAN OR NURSE PRACTITIONER.
   25    (II) SUCH ADDITIONAL COVERAGE MAY BE SUBJECT TO ANNUAL DEDUCTIBLES AND
   26  COINSURANCE AS MAY BE DEEMED APPROPRIATE BY THE  SUPERINTENDENT  AND  AS
   27  ARE  CONSISTENT WITH THOSE ESTABLISHED FOR OTHER BENEFITS WITHIN A GIVEN
   28  POLICY.
   29    (III) EACH MAMMOGRAPHY REPORT PROVIDED  TO  A  PATIENT  SHALL  INCLUDE
   30  INFORMATION  ABOUT BREAST DENSITY, BASED ON THE BREAST IMAGING REPORTING
   31  AND DATA SYSTEM ESTABLISHED BY THE AMERICAN COLLEGE OF RADIOLOGY.  WHERE
   32  APPLICABLE,  SUCH  REPORT  SHALL  INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING NOTICE: "IF YOUR
   33  MAMMOGRAM DEMONSTRATES THAT YOU HAVE DENSE BREAST  TISSUE,  WHICH  COULD
   34  HIDE SMALL ABNORMALITIES, YOU MIGHT BENEFIT FROM SUPPLEMENTARY SCREENING
   35  TESTS,  WHICH  CAN INCLUDE A BREAST ULTRASOUND SCREENING OR A BREAST MRI
   36  EXAMINATION, OR BOTH, DEPENDING  ON  YOUR  INDIVIDUAL  RISK  FACTORS.  A
   37  REPORT  OF  YOUR  MAMMOGRAPHY  RESULTS, WHICH CONTAINS INFORMATION ABOUT
   38  YOUR BREAST DENSITY, HAS BEEN SENT TO YOUR PHYSICIAN'S  OFFICE  AND  YOU
   39  SHOULD  CONTACT  YOUR  PHYSICIAN  IF  YOU HAVE ANY QUESTIONS OR CONCERNS
   40  ABOUT THIS REPORT."
   41    S 3. Subsection (p) of section 4303 of the insurance law is amended by
   42  adding a new paragraph 4 to read as follows:
   43    (4) (A) SUCH COVERAGE SHALL PROVIDE ADDITIONAL COVERAGE FOR COMPREHEN-
   44  SIVE ULTRASOUND SCREENING AND/OR MAGNETIC RESONANCE IMAGING (MRI) OF  AN
   45  ENTIRE BREAST OR THE ENTIRETY OF BOTH BREASTS IF:
   46    (I)  A  MAMMOGRAM  DEMONSTRATES  HETEROGENEOUS  OR DENSE BREAST TISSUE
   47  BASED ON THE BREAST IMAGING REPORTING AND DATA SYSTEM ESTABLISHED BY THE
   48  AMERICAN COLLEGE OF RADIOLOGY; OR
   49    (II) A WOMAN IS BELIEVED TO BE AT INCREASED RISK FOR BREAST CANCER DUE
   50  TO FAMILY HISTORY OR PRIOR PERSONAL HISTORY OF BREAST  CANCER,  POSITIVE
   51  GENETIC  TESTING  OR  OTHER  INDICATIONS  AS  DETERMINED BY SUCH WOMAN'S
   52  PHYSICIAN OR NURSE PRACTITIONER.
   53    THE ADDITIONAL COVERAGE REQUIRED IN THIS SUBPARAGRAPH MAY  BE  SUBJECT
   54  TO  ANNUAL  DEDUCTIBLES  AND COINSURANCE AS MAY BE DEEMED APPROPRIATE BY
   55  THE SUPERINTENDENT AND AS ARE  CONSISTENT  WITH  THOSE  ESTABLISHED  FOR
   56  OTHER BENEFITS WITHIN A GIVEN POLICY.

       A. 1431                             3

    1    (B) EACH MAMMOGRAPHY REPORT PROVIDED TO A PATIENT SHALL INCLUDE INFOR-
    2  MATION  ABOUT  BREAST DENSITY, BASED ON THE BREAST IMAGING REPORTING AND
    3  DATA SYSTEM ESTABLISHED BY THE  AMERICAN  COLLEGE  OF  RADIOLOGY.  WHERE
    4  APPLICABLE,  SUCH  REPORT  SHALL  INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING NOTICE: "IF YOUR
    5  MAMMOGRAM  DEMONSTRATES  THAT  YOU HAVE DENSE BREAST TISSUE, WHICH COULD
    6  HIDE SMALL ABNORMALITIES, YOU MIGHT BENEFIT FROM SUPPLEMENTARY SCREENING
    7  TESTS, WHICH CAN INCLUDE A BREAST ULTRASOUND SCREENING OR A  BREAST  MRI
    8  EXAMINATION,  OR  BOTH,  DEPENDING  ON  YOUR  INDIVIDUAL RISK FACTORS. A
    9  REPORT OF YOUR MAMMOGRAPHY RESULTS,  WHICH  CONTAINS  INFORMATION  ABOUT
   10  YOUR  BREAST  DENSITY,  HAS BEEN SENT TO YOUR PHYSICIAN'S OFFICE AND YOU
   11  SHOULD CONTACT YOUR PHYSICIAN IF YOU  HAVE  ANY  QUESTIONS  OR  CONCERNS
   12  ABOUT THIS REPORT."
   13    S  4.  Paragraph  7 of subsection (d) of section 4326 of the insurance
   14  law, as added by chapter 1 of the laws of 1999, is amended  to  read  as
   15  follows:
   16    (7) adult preventive health services consisting of mammography screen-
   17  ing,  AS  PROVIDED  IN  SUBSECTION  (P)  OF  SECTION FOUR THOUSAND THREE
   18  HUNDRED THREE OF THIS ARTICLE;  cervical  cytology  screening;  periodic
   19  physical  examinations  no  more  than once every three years; and adult
   20  immunizations;
   21    S 5. This act shall take effect on the sixtieth  day  after  it  shall
   22  have become a law.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the insurance law, in relation to requiring health insurance policies to cover comprehensive ultrasound screening and magnetic resonance imaging for breast cancer in certain cases and requiring the provision of certain information relating to breast density to patients
